variables.name: project.link.ref
variables.description: Link to activate the main process that must be started by the Hop Process Executor. The link is relative to the project home directory.

variables.name: hop.user
variables.description: The operating system user that will run the Hop Process execution. This user must have read/write permissions on the project home directory.

variables.name: hop.program.name
variables.description: A virtual name assigned to Apache Hop to be inserted in events logging tables as a reference for the running instance

variables.name: sys.unhandled.exception.subcategory.generic
variables.description: The generic subcategory for unhandled system exceptions. This is used to categorize exceptions in the logs.

variables.name: integrations.db.config.schema
variables.description: Name of the schema containing the configuration tables for the integrations database.

variables.name: integrations.db.log.schema
variables.description: Name of schema containing the logs tables for the integrations database.

variables.name: integrations.db.host
variables.description: Name of the hosts where the integrations database is running. This can be an IP address or a hostname.

variables.name: integrations.db.connection.name
variables.description: Name of the connection assigned in Apache Hop for the integrations database. This is used to connect to the database during Hop Process execution.

variables.name: integrations.db.name
variables.description: Name of the database containing the configuration and logs tables for the integrations database.

variables.name: integrations.db.port
variables.description: Port of the integrations database. This is the port where the database server is listening for connections.

variables.name: integrations.db.user
variables.description: Username used to connect to the integrations database. This user must have permissions to read/write in the specified database.

variables.name: integrations.db.pwd
variables.description: Password used to connect to the integrations database. This user must have permissions to read/write in the specified database.

variables.name: email.application.error.feedback.enabled
variables.description: Flag that enables or disables the sending of feedback emails after a process execution if application error. Set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable

variables.name: email.notactive.feedback.enabled
variables.description: Flag that enables or disables the sending of feedback emails if the process is paused. Set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable

variables.name: email.lock.feedback.enabled
variables.description: Flag that enables or disables the sending of feedback emails if the same process is alredy running. Set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable

variables.name: email.success.feedback.enabled
variables.description: Flag that enables or disables the sending of success feedback emails after a process execution. Set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable

variables.name: email.fail.feedback.enabled
variables.description: Flag that enables or disables the sending of failure feedback emails after a process execution. Set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable.

variables.name: mail.isauthenticated
variables.description: Flag to indicate if the SMTP server requires authentication. Set to true if authentication is needed, false otherwise.

variables.name: mail.isgmail
variables.description: Flag to indicate if the SMTP server is Gmail. Set to true if using Gmail, false otherwise.

variables.name: smtp.mail.host
variables.description: Name of the host where the SMTP server is running. This can be an IP address or a hostname.

variables.name: smtp.mail.port
variables.description: Port where the SMTP server is listening for connections.

variables.name: smtp.mail.user
variables.description: Username used to connect to SMTP server. This is used for authentication if the SMTP server requires it.

variables.name: smtp.mail.psw
variables.description: Password used to connect to SMTP server. This is used for authentication if the SMTP server requires it.

variables.name: smtp.trusted.hosts
variables.description: Comma-separated list of trusted hosts for the SMTP server. This can be used to allow connections from specific hosts without authentication.

variables.name: smtp.check.server.identity
variables.description: Flag to indiceate if the server identity should be checked when connecting to the SMTP server. Set to true to enable, false to disable.

variables.name: mail.from.displayname
variables.description: Label displayed in the 'From' field of the email. This is the name that will appear as the sender of the email.

variables.name: mail.from.email
variables.description: Email address used in the 'From' field of the email. This is the address that will appear as the sender of the email.

variables.name: mail.subject
variables.description: First part of the text displayed in the subject of the email. It includes the hostname and the base process name.

variables.name: mail.subject.error
variables.description: Text displayed in the subject of the email when an error occurs due to system exceptions. It includes the base process name.

variables.name: mail.subject.success
variables.description: Text displayed in the subject ot the email when the process execution is successful. It includes the base process name.

variables.name: mail.subject.lock
variables.value: ${mail.subject} Same instance is still running. Execution stopped.
variables.description: Text displayed in the subject ot the email when a lock occurs that prevents the process from executing. It includes the base process name

variables.name: mail.subject.notactive
variables.value: ${mail.subject} This instance is paused. Execution not started.
variables.description: Text displayed in the subject ot the email when the process is paused. It includes the base process name

variables.name: mail.subject.application.error
variables.description: Text displayed in the subject of the email when application errors occurs during process execution. It includes the base process name.

variables.name: default.mail.destination.addresses
variables.description: Default set of email addresses to included wherever needed. Email addresses are separated by spaces.

variables.name: success.mail.destination.addresses
variables.description: Set of email addresses to send success feedback emails to. Email addresses are separated by spaces. It can includes the default addresses if needed. It defaults to the value of 'default.mail.destination.addresses'.

variables.name: errors.mail.destination.addresses
variables.description: Set of email addresses to send error feedback emails to. Email addresses are separated by spaces. It can includes the default addresses if needed. It defaults to the value of 'default.mail.destination.addresses'.

variables.name: lock.mail.destination.addresses
variables.description: Set of feedback's email addresses to send because a lock is present. Email addresses are separated by spaces. It can includes the default addresses if needed. It defaults to the value of 'default.mail.destination.addresses'.

variables.name: notactive.mail.destination.addresses
variables.description: Set of feedback's email addresses to send because the process is not active. Email addresses are separated by spaces. It can includes the default addresses if needed. It defaults to the value of 'default.mail.destination.addresses'.

variables.name: application.error.mail.destination.addresses
variables.description: Set of email addresses to send application's error feedback emails to. Email addresses are separated by spaces. It can includes the default addresses if needed. It defaults to the value of 'default.mail.destination.addresses'.

variables.name: success.mail.text
variables.value:
The process ${p_base_process_name} running on server ${v_hostname} was terminated successfully.

Execution's log file available at: ${p_log_filename}.

PLEASE DO NOT REPLAY TO THIS EMAIL!
variables.description: Sample text for the success feedback email. It includes the base process name, hostname, and log file name.

variables.name: error.mail.text
variables.value:
The process was terminated abnormally because of an Exception.

Execution's log file available at: ${p_log_filename}.

PLEASE DO NOT REPLAY TO THIS EMAIL!
variables.description: Sample text message for the error feedback email. It includes the log file name.

variables.name: lock.mail.text
variables.value:
The process ${p_base_process_name} running on server ${v_hostname} can't be started because same process started at ${v_last_instance_start_timestamp} is not yet terminated.

Execution's log file available at: ${p_log_filename}

PLEASE DO NOT REPLAY TO THIS EMAIL!
variables.description: Sample text message used because a process cannot be started because a lock occurs. It includes the base process name, hostname, last job run timestamp, and log file name.

variables.name: application.error.mail.text
variables.value:
During process's execution we collected some exceptions on integrations_log_details. The detailed list of exception is in the attachment to this email.

If needed, execution's log file is available at: ${p_log_filename}

PLEASE DO NOT REPLAY TO THIS EMAIL!
variables.description: Sample text message used when an application error occurs. It includes the log file name and mentions that detailed exceptions are in the attachment.

variables.name: notactive.mail.text
variables.value:
The process ${p_base_process_name} running on server ${v_hostname} can't be started because is set to not active.

Execution's log file available at: ${p_log_filename}

PLEASE DO NOT REPLAY TO THIS EMAIL!
variables.description: Sample text message used when a process cannot be started because it is not active. It includes the base process name, hostname, and log file name.
